title: Schema for table object
description: An annotated table is a table that is annotated with additional metadata.
$comment: Model for tabular data and metadata, Section 4.2 Tables.

columns.description: the list of columns in the table. A table must have one or more columns and the order of the columns within the list is significant and must be preserved by applications.

tableDirection.description: the direction in which the columns in the table should be displayed, as described in section 6.5.1 Bidirectional Tables; the value of this annotation may also become the value of the text direction annotation on columns and cells within the table, if the textDirection property is set to inherit (the default).

foreignKeys.description: a list of foreign keys on the table, as defined in [tabular-metadata], which may be an empty list.

id.description: an identifier for this table, or null if this is undefined.

notes.description: any number of additional annotations on the table. This annotation may be empty.

rows.description: the list of rows in the table. A table must have one or more rows and the order of the rows within the list is significant and must be preserved by applications.

schema.description: a URL referencing a schema applied to this table, or null.

suppressOutput.description: a boolean that indicates whether or not this table should be suppressed in any output generated from converting the group of tables, that this table belongs to, into another format, as described in section 6.7 Converting Tables.

transformations.description: a (possibly empty) list of specifications for converting this table into other formats, as defined in [tabular-metadata].

url.description: the URL of the source of the data in the table, or null if this is undefined.
